summary: An FBI 302 report documenting a phone call on January 8, 2020, with a mother (DOB 11/28/1944) regarding her daughter's interactions with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The mother states she did not know them well, recounts a visit to Epstein's home, and expresses strong negative views about both, particularly Maxwell, whom she describes as 'evil' and worse than Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The mother states she did not know him well, recounts he wanted her and her daughter to move to New York with him and Maxwell, and describes him as 'evil'.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The mother states she did not know her well, describes her as 'evil, evil as can be' and worse than Epstein because Maxwell appealed to her as a mother.

connections.description: Described together by the mother as 'evil' individuals who wanted the mother and her daughter to move to New York with them.
The mother felt Maxwell was worse than Epstein because Maxwell appealed to her as a mother.

events.title: FBI Phone Interview with Mother
events.description: An FBI agent contacted a mother (DOB 11/28/1944) by phone to schedule an in-person interview. During the call, she provided information about her daughter's interactions with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: A mother (DOB 11/28/1944) stated she and her daughter visited Jeffrey Epstein's home on one occasion.
Epstein and Maxwell later proposed that the mother and her daughter move to New York with them, which the mother declined.
The mother described both Epstein and Maxwell as 'evil' and stated they 'destroyed her life'.
The mother felt Ghislaine Maxwell was worse than Jeffrey Epstein because Maxwell appealed to her as a mother.
The mother indicated she was unaware of what happened to her daughter initially because she was working, and her daughter cried when later confronted.
